com.noctarius.tengi.spi.connection

Class AbstractConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.noctarius.tengi.spi.connection.AbstractConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connection, ConnectedListener, ConnectionListener, DisconnectedListener, ExceptionListener, AutoCloseable

    public abstract class AbstractConnection
extends Object
implements Connection, ConnectionListener
    The AbstractConnection acts as a base class for server- and client-side Connection implementations. It handles listener registrations as well as basic notification logic.

        public Identifier getConnectionId()
        Description copied from interface: Connection

      • removeMessageListener

        public void removeMessageListener(Identifier registrationIdentifier)
        Description copied from interface: Connection

        Removes a previously registered MessageListener based on the Identifier returned from the registration.

        Using this method, an anonymous listener implementations or Java 8 lambdas can be registered and removed.

        Specified by:
        removeMessageListener in interface Connection
        Parameters:
        registrationIdentifier - the Identifier generated while registration

      • writeObject

        public <O> CompletableFuture<Message> writeObject(O object)
                                           throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: Connection
        Writes a common object to this connection. This types needs to be serializable using a previously registered Marshaller or must be of a commonly supported (internally supported) type. Objects send using this method are automatically wrapped into a Message object before sent and will be delivered to a registered MessageListener on the receiver side.
        Specified by:
        writeObject in interface Connection
        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the object to write
        Parameters:
        object - object to write
        Returns:
        a CompletionFuture representing the running serialization and sending process
        Throws:
        Exception - whenever an unexpected situation occurs while writing or sending the object

      • disconnect

        public CompletableFuture<Connection> disconnect()
        Description copied from interface: Connection
        Disconnects the connection and releases any internally acquired resources that are assigned to this connection.
        Specified by:
        disconnect in interface Connection
        Returns:
        a CompletionFuture representing the pending disconnection process

        public void close()
           throws Exception
        Specified by:

        Throws:

      • onConnection

        public void onConnection(Connection connection)
        Description copied from interface: ConnectedListener

        This method is called whenever a connection has connected to setup any kind of additional application state necessary or allocate additional resources.

        Event handlers are called in an internal event thread-pool which is not meant to handle long running operations. If long operations need to be executed, offloading to another thread-pool is strongly recommended.

        Specified by:
        onConnection in interface ConnectedListener
        Parameters:
        connection - the connected Connection

      • onDisconnect

        public void onDisconnect(Connection connection)
        Description copied from interface: DisconnectedListener

        This method is called whenever a connection was disconnected to clean up application state, free internal resources or similar actions.

        Event handlers are called in an internal event thread-pool which is not meant to handle long running operations. If long operations need to be executed, offloading to another thread-pool is strongly recommended.

        Specified by:
        onDisconnect in interface DisconnectedListener
        Parameters:
        connection - the disconnected Connection

      • onExceptionally

        public void onExceptionally(Connection connection,
                            Throwable throwable)
        Description copied from interface: ExceptionListener

        This method is called whenever an operations, that is assigned to known connection, has thrown an exception.

        Event handlers are called in an internal event thread-pool which is not meant to handle long running operations. If long operations need to be executed, offloading to another thread-pool is strongly recommended.

        Specified by:
        onExceptionally in interface ExceptionListener
        Parameters:
        connection - the connected Connection
        throwable - the thrown Throwable
